objectives.en: The objective of this course is to introduce students to the principles and methods of software architecture in an enterprise environment, with an emphasis on the integration of heterogeneous software systems. The course covers key principles and methods for designing, developing, and integrating enterprise information systems. The course introduces modern approaches to enterprise system integration, including Service-oriented and Microservices architectures and their associated technologies. In addition to the technical aspects, the course will also cover organizational aspects of enterprise system integration.
objectives.et: Tutvustada ettevõttesisese tarkvara arhitektuuri põhimõtteid ja meetodeid, eeskätt heterogeensete süsteemide osas. Anda ülevaade kaasaegsetest lähenemisviisidest ettevõttesüsteemide integreerimisel, sh komponendipõhisest arhitektuurist ja teenustele orienteeritud arhitektuurist. Lisaks tehnilistele aspektidele kaetakse ka  ettevõttesüsteemide integreerimise organisatsioonilisi küsimusi.

learning_outcomes.en: On successful completion of this course, students should be able to:
1. Demonstrate knowledge of the technical and organizational challenges of enterprise system integration.
learning_outcomes.et: 1. Tunneb ettevõttesüsteemide integreerimise tehnilisi ning organisatsioonilisi probleeme ning väljakutseid.

learning_outcomes.en: 2. Understand the relative advantages and scope of applicability of different approaches to enterprise system integration.
learning_outcomes.et: 2. Oskab näha ettevõttesüsteemide integreerimise erinevate lähenemisviiside suhtelisi eeliseid ja nende rakendatavuspiire.

learning_outcomes.en: 3. Analyse, design and build enterprise systems using the principles of service-oriented architectures (chiefly REST) in a heterogenous environment.
learning_outcomes.et: 3. Oskab analüüsida, kavandada ja luua ettevõttesüsteeme, kasutades teenustele (REST) orienteeritud arhitektuuri printsiipe heterogeense keskkonna puhul.

grade_preconditions.en:
There will be two assessment parts:

1. Assignments  + Project (total 50 points).
  1.1. Assignments (20 points):   there will be three team assignments.
  1.2. A project  (30 points):   students will develop in teams a software system that integrates multiple heterogeneous applications. The project will be assessed through several checkpoints.

A grade of 21 points (of 50 points) or more in the assignments and the project will be required to be eligible for the final exam.

grade_evaluation.en:
There will be two assessment parts:

1. Assignments  + Project (total 50 points).
  1.1. Assignments (20 points):   there will be three team assignments.
  1.2. A project  (30 points):   students will develop in teams a software system that integrates multiple heterogeneous applications. The project will be assessed through several checkpoints.

2. A final exam (50 points). A grade of 20 points or less in the final exam will be mapped into a final fail grade (F).


The final grade will be calculated as the sum of the points earned from the assignments, project, and final exam. The resulting sum (out of 100) will be mapped to a grade between A and F using the standard University scale, as follows:

A final grade of 50 points or less will be mapped into a fail grade (F).
A final grade of 51-60 points will be mapped into a grade (E).
A final grade of 61-70 points will be mapped into a grade (D).
A final grade of 71-80 points will be mapped into a grade (C).
A final grade of 81-90 points will be mapped into a grade (B).
A final grade of 91-100 points will be mapped into a grade (A).

Two exams will be offered, and one supplementary exam (resit) will be offered to students who are unable to attend or fail any of the two exams.
